COMMENT_TX: Tremendous blow high into upper deck of RF stands
It began to rain as the Browns took their turn at bat
It began to rain hard at this time
$Kress slipped on the wet field and pop fly fell
Lyons was injured when he collided with Crouse after making the play.  He was jarred by the impact, but was apparently alright as he was escorted to the bench.
Reynolds misjudged it and it went over him
Pop fly bounced off Kamm's glove but Cissell caught it
Watwood: great backhand stab of hard liner
Great throw by Falk held Kamm at 2B
Myatt tried to catch Metzler off 3B while Kamm stole 2B, but his throw went into LF.
Seemed headed for the pavilion when it left the bat, but the wind carried it back within Averill's reach.
Hard, low liner right at Clancy
Singled on very next pitch following FLE5
Hardest hit ball of the game
Hard drive; Kerr touched with his bare hand but couldn't hold on.
Falk came up to the accompaniment of the usual boos
Lind let Averill's throw-in get away from him
Off Lind's glove. Play was stopped by the umpires when rain began to fall heavily.  Play was resumed after a 25-minute delay.
Falk: sensational running, diving catch of short foul
Barehanded catch by Hoffman when the wind carried it over him
Hidden ball trick. Kamm kept the ball concealed in his glove after running down Hodapp.  Jamieson had reached 3B, but when he strayed off that bag, Kamm tagged him out to complete a triple play.
Metzler scored when Lind threw to 1B.
Nice play on line smash and nipped him at 1B
Hit over the double deck of RF stands; Gehrig became the second player to clear the RF stands (Ruth was 1st).
Into lower deck of LF bleachers
Ruth was trapped between 1B & 2B but Clancy dropped throw
Into upper deck of RF stands
Into upper deck of RF stands
Unclear what type of HR this was: 'Meusel bounced a HR off the RCF fence.  Three successive home runs ties a world's record.'
To upper deck of RF stands
A strong northwest wind carried fly balls all over the park.
Scratch single on a funny high bounder that jumped over Heimach's head.
Lined into lower deck of LCF bleachers
Leaping try by Durocher who knocked it down
Metzler failed to hold wind-blown short fly after a long run
The rain seemed to be blowing over
Tricky bounder past Kamm between box and 3B.
Metzler came in from LF to make putout
Off scoreboard in deep LCF; missed HR by inches
Weather: chilling wind from Lake Michigan
Watwood was hit on the ankle
Hit & run through the vacated spot
Off McKain's glove to Kamm whose late throw to 2B was wild
Nice catch by Hoffman who injured his neck crashing into the wall.

Following events gleaned from Det Free Press & Chi Tribune:
Wild throw backed up by Berg; Alexander overran 1B
Hunnefield dove and got a piece of it
Autry's throw to 2B nailed pitcher McKain in the face. He was knocked down and stunned, but resumed play.
Infield single; Autry muffed throw to plate but the thrower was not identified.
Sewell tried for 2B when Metzler fumbled
When Cissell let Metzler's throw get through him, Averill tried to score.
Faber beat Holloway to the 1B bag; assume 2-3.
Rained earlier; weather more desireable at game time
2000 cash customers, but most of the large crowd were women and children admitted free.
Hoffman let long fly get away from him
$Kerr was spiked and limped off the field

Sparkling catch, crashing against the wall, and was slightly stunned.

Pitching duel between last remaining spitball pitchers in A.L.

Ground rule double although it bounced into stands.
